title: Raise correct error type when passing invalid covariance matrix to MultivariateNormal
body_html:
Right now if you pass in a covariance matrix that is not positive definite into the MultivariateNormal constructor, this will raise a RuntimeError because it tries to construct _unbroadcasted_scale_tril via Cholesky Decomposition before checking the argument validity.

Instead, if validate_args=True, this for consistency should raise a ValueError (e.g. by applying constraint.positive_definite.check to the passed covariance matrix before attempting the Cholesky decomposition).

body:
Right now if you pass in a covariance matrix that is not positive definite into the MultivariateNormal constructor, this will raise a `RuntimeError` because it tries to construct `_unbroadcasted_scale_tril` via Cholesky Decomposition before checking the argument validity. 

Instead, if `validate_args=True`, this for consistency should raise a ValueError (e.g. by applying `constraint.positive_definite.check` to the passed covariance matrix before attempting the Cholesky decomposition).
